title: Nexium Typeface
content:
I was working on a project for my typography class and wanted to use a medicine for the project. I can’t seem to find any known typeface that goes with any medicine on the market right now. I was really wanting to do Nexium. Does anyone know if this drug was custom designed or if it has a common typeface that can be downloaded, or bought? I’m new in the type world, so go easy on me.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023163141im_/http:/typophile.com/files/footer_nexium_pill_5004.gif)

 [‹ Granite in Web Layout Design](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023163141/http:/typophile.com/node/50787 "Go to previous forum topic") [I'm looking for a Serif font with big, strong, prominent punctuation ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023163141/http:/typophile.com/node/50752 "Go to next forum topic")
author: graphics87

comments.content:
Hi,

It looks like Nexium is written in [Rotis SemiSerif](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023163141/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/agfa-rotis-semi-serif/bold/)

The tittle (dot) on the ’i’ has been taken off.

Good luck!

Objection; that is definitely not Rotis :-). I think it looks like a sans that everybody knows but I can’t name right now for some reason, with little semi serifs stuck on.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023163141im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Nexium_6570.jpg)
It’s Argo by Gerard Unger from [DTL](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023163141/http:/www.dutchtypelibrary.nl/) with serifs stuck on it.

BTW.  
This should have been posted on the [Type ID Board](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023163141/http:/typophile.com/forum/29).
